bin.nano:
#!/bin/bash
echo 'Nice try! Real nano is in /usr/bin'
bin.nmap:
#!/bin/bash
echo 'Running nmap scan...
Scanning target 10.0.0.66...
22/tcp: SSH open
80/tcp: HTTP open
443/tcp: HTTPS open'
bin.netcat:
#!/bin/bash
echo 'Establishing reverse shell...\nConnection established to 10.0.0.66 on port 4444'

etc.motd:
Welcome to CTF-OS!
Your mission: discover vulnerabilities, capture flags, and secure the network. Stay stealthy and exploit wisely.
etc.issue:
CTF-OS 1.0
[WARNING] This system is monitored by an advanced IDS. Unauthorized access is tracked.
etc.sudoers:
# Security notice:
# You're not in the sudoers file... but nice try!

user..bashrc:
# Aliases for pentesting
alias scan='nmap -sV 10.0.0.66'
alias exploit='echo "Attempting exploit..."'

.ssh.id_rsa:

FAKE_KEY_DONT_TRY_THIS
-----END OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY-----

Roses are red
Violets are blue
Buffer overflows
Will break you.

Dear diary,
Today I bypassed a firewall using a custom reverse shell exploit. The flag was almost mine...

Network topology:
[Router]---[Firewall]---[Target]
(Hidden access point discovered behind the proxy)

2) Activate incident response plan
3) Profit (ethically!)

cat /etc/issue
